Package oop.cw.ticketing.core

Class TicketPool

java.lang.Object
oop.cw.ticketing.core.TicketPool
@Component public class TicketPool extends Object
Represents a pool of tickets for a specific event in the ticketing system. The TicketPool is responsible for managing ticket availability, allowing vendors to add tickets to the pool and customers to purchase tickets from it. The ticket pool is synchronized to allow safe concurrent access by multiple threads, ensuring that the ticket addition and removal processes are thread-safe. This class is designed to work in a Spring Boot context, with dependency injection for the event, maximum ticket capacity, customer retrieval rate, and ticket release rate using the Autowired and Value annotations for configuration properties.

  • Constructor Details

    • TicketPool

      @Autowired public TicketPool(@Value("${ticketpool.event}") String event, @Value("${ticketpool.maxTicketCapacity}") int maxTicketCapacity, @Value("${ticketpool.customerRetrievalRate}") int customerRetrievalRate, @Value("${ticketpool.ticketReleaseRate}") int ticketReleaseRate)
      Constructor for creating a TicketPool object, with dependency injection for the event, maximum ticket capacity, customer retrieval rate, and ticket release rate.
      Parameters:
      event - The event name for which tickets are managed.
      maxTicketCapacity - The maximum number of tickets that the pool can hold.
      customerRetrievalRate - The rate at which customers retrieve tickets (used for simulating time).
      ticketReleaseRate - The rate at which vendors release tickets into the pool (used for simulating time).

  • Method Details

    • addTicket

      public boolean addTicket(String vendor)
      Attempts to add a ticket to the pool. If the pool is not full, the ticket is added to the list, and the total ticket count is updated.
      Parameters:
      vendor - The name of the vendor releasing the ticket.
      Returns:
      true if the ticket was successfully added to the pool, false if the pool is full.

    • removeTicket

      public boolean removeTicket(String buyer)
      Attempts to remove a ticket from the pool. If no tickets are available, the method will wait for tickets to become available or until the pool is sold out.
      Parameters:
      buyer - The name of the customer attempting to purchase a ticket.
      Returns:
      true if a ticket was successfully purchased, false if no tickets are available.

      public String getEvent()

      public int getTicketReleaseRate()

    • setTicketReleaseRate

      public void setTicketReleaseRate(int ticketReleaseRate)

    • isPoolFull

      public boolean isPoolFull()
      Checks if the ticket pool has reached its maximum capacity.
      Returns:
      true if the pool is full, false otherwise.

    • isSoldOut

      public boolean isSoldOut()
      Checks if the ticket pool is sold out, meaning there are no tickets left in the pool and the maximum capacity has been reached.
      Returns:
      true if the pool is sold out, false otherwise.
